{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Marketer",
  "description": "HT-Limited is Business Management Consulting firm, offering support in business development, human resources management and administration. HT-Limited is a member of the Chartered Institute of Personnel Management in Nigeria, with offices in Lagos, Nigeria and Accra, Ghana. We provide customized HR consulting solutions for employers looking to reduce risks and overhead costs, so more time can be spent on revenue generating activities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking a creative, driven, and results-oriented Marketing Officer to join our dynamic marketing team. As a Marketing Officer, you will be responsible for implementing and executing marketing strategies that enhance brand visibility, drive sales, and increase market share.
	You will work closely with the marketing team to develop campaigns, analyze market trends, and manage communications across multiple platforms to engage target audiences.


Key Responsibilities


	Campaign Planning &amp; Execution
	Market Research
	Collaboration &amp; Communication
	Building sustained, profitable ties with our customers
	Compiling informed reports to guide all marketing-related efforts.
	Deploying successful marketing campaigns from ideation to execution
	Build strategic relationships and partner with key industry players, agencies and vendors
	Analyze consumer behavior and adjust email and advertising campaigns accordingly.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements
Education and Experience:


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications, or a related field
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in marketing.
	Proven ability to create and implement successful marketing campaigns.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong understanding of marketing principles and strategies.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
	Strong creative thinking with a focus on digital content.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Attention to detail and problem-solving skills.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to:&nbsp;resumes@ht-limitedng.net&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.",

Marketer Job at HT-Limited




        
    

        
        HT-Limited is Business Management Consulting firm, offering support in business development, human resources management and administration. HT-Limited is a member of the Chartered Institute of Personnel Management in Nigeria, with offices in Lagos, Nigeria and Accra, Ghana. We provide customized HR consulting solutions for employers looking to reduce risks and overhead costs, so more time can be spent on revenue generating activities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

            
    




	We are seeking a creative, driven, and results-oriented Marketing Officer to join our dynamic marketing team. As a Marketing Officer, you will be responsible for implementing and executing marketing strategies that enhance brand visibility, drive sales, and increase market share.
	You will work closely with the marketing team to develop campaigns, analyze market trends, and manage communications across multiple platforms to engage target audiences.


Key Responsibilities


	Campaign Planning & Execution
	Market Research
	Collaboration & Communication
	Building sustained, profitable ties with our customers
	Compiling informed reports to guide all marketing-related efforts.
	Deploying successful marketing campaigns from ideation to execution
	Build strategic relationships and partner with key industry players, agencies and vendors
	Analyze consumer behavior and adjust email and advertising campaigns accordingly.


Qualifications & Requirements
Education and Experience:


	Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications, or a related field
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in marketing.
	Proven ability to create and implement successful marketing campaigns.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong understanding of marketing principles and strategies.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
	Strong creative thinking with a focus on digital content.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Attention to detail and problem-solving skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: resumes@ht-limitedng.net using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Construction Project Manager",
  "description": "Talent Towers&nbsp; -&nbsp;Founded with a clear purpose to transform the human resource landscape in Africa, Talent Towers is a people-first Human Capital Solutions firm committed to delivering innovative, practical, and impactful solutions that drive business performance and workforce excellence.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Construction Project Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Description


	Manage project timelines, budgets, and resources to ensure timely delivery
	Supervise site activities and ensure compliance with design specifications, safety standards, and regulations
	Coordinate contractors, suppliers, and internal teams for smooth project execution
	Monitor project progress, prepare reports, and resolve on-site issues promptly
	Ensure quality control and adherence to agreed project scope.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Civil Engineering, or a related field
	2 - 3 years of experience
	Proficiency in Project Management and experience with related methodologies
	Knowledge of Inspection protocols and Logistics Management
	Strong organizational and communication skills
	Problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.


Salary
N300,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@talenttowers.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Construction Project Manager Job at Talent Towers




        
    

        
        Talent Towers  - Founded with a clear purpose to transform the human resource landscape in Africa, Talent Towers is a people-first Human Capital Solutions firm committed to delivering innovative, practical, and impactful solutions that drive business performance and workforce excellence.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Construction Project Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Description
     

            
    




	Manage project timelines, budgets, and resources to ensure timely delivery
	Supervise site activities and ensure compliance with design specifications, safety standards, and regulations
	Coordinate contractors, suppliers, and internal teams for smooth project execution
	Monitor project progress, prepare reports, and resolve on-site issues promptly
	Ensure quality control and adherence to agreed project scope.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering, or a related field
	2 - 3 years of experience
	Proficiency in Project Management and experience with related methodologies
	Knowledge of Inspection protocols and Logistics Management
	Strong organizational and communication skills
	Problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.


Salary
N300,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@talenttowers.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory & Store Officer",
  "description": "Custom Gifts &amp; Designs is a reputable business platform that promotes consumer access to premium gift packaging services and quality retail supplies. Our platform is propagated via partnerships and proven proprietary business systems that assure a holistic shopping experience for every occasion.&nbsp;Together with everyone in our ecosystem, we continue to develop our iconic CGD&trade; brand by inspiring stronger social ties with our novelty gifts offering.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory &amp; Store Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	The Inventory &amp; Store Officer is responsible for the management, control, and accountability of all stock and products within the company.
	This role ensures accurate inventory records, proper storage, timely order fulfilment, and effective collaboration with Sales, Digital, and Finance units.
	The position is critical to operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities
Inventory Management &amp; ERP:


	Upload and manage all products on the ERP system
	Receive, inspect, record, and document all incoming stock
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date inventory records at all times


Store &amp; Warehouse Operations:


	Arrange products neatly on shelves and in the warehouse
	Ensure proper labeling, storage, and organization of items
	Clean and dust shelves regularly to maintain hygiene standards
	Prevent loss, damage, theft, or misplacement of stock


Order Fulfilment:


	Receive all paid customer orders from the Sales &amp; Customer Experience Unit
	Pick, pack, and prepare customer orders accurately
	Ensure all customer orders are dispatched within 24 hours


Personalisation &amp; Digital Support:


	Personalise customer orders strictly based on approved instructions
	Arrange products for party packs, gift sets, and digital/photo/video shoots
	Support the Digital / E-commerce Unit during content creation


Internal Coordination:


	Release products to Cashiers strictly for ERP-recorded sales
	Maintain clear communication with Sales, Digital, and Finance teams


Education &amp; Qualifications


	Minimum educational qualification: ND or NCE&nbsp;with 0-1 year experience
	Additional training in inventory, logistics, or store management is an added advantage


Other Requirements:


	Must reside within Lekki / Jakande axis
	Willingness to work on a rotational shift basis
	Ability to work in a structured, control-driven environment
	High level of honesty, discipline, and accountability
	Strict compliance with company policies and procedures is mandatory.


Required Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong attention to detail and record-keeping ability
	Basic knowledge of inventory management and stock control
	Ability to use ERP systems and basic computer applications
	Good organizational and time-management skills
	Ability to follow instructions and company procedures strictly
	Teamwork and effective communication skills
	Physical stamina for handling stock and warehouse activities


Method of Application&nbsp;

Inventory & Store Officer Job at Custom Gifts & Designs




        
    

        
        Custom Gifts & Designs is a reputable business platform that promotes consumer access to premium gift packaging services and quality retail supplies. Our platform is propagated via partnerships and proven proprietary business systems that assure a holistic shopping experience for every occasion. Together with everyone in our ecosystem, we continue to develop our iconic CGD™ brand by inspiring stronger social ties with our novelty gifts offering.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory & Store Officer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

            
    




	The Inventory & Store Officer is responsible for the management, control, and accountability of all stock and products within the company.
	This role ensures accurate inventory records, proper storage, timely order fulfilment, and effective collaboration with Sales, Digital, and Finance units.
	The position is critical to operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities
Inventory Management & ERP:


	Upload and manage all products on the ERP system
	Receive, inspect, record, and document all incoming stock
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date inventory records at all times


Store & Warehouse Operations:


	Arrange products neatly on shelves and in the warehouse
	Ensure proper labeling, storage, and organization of items
	Clean and dust shelves regularly to maintain hygiene standards
	Prevent loss, damage, theft, or misplacement of stock


Order Fulfilment:


	Receive all paid customer orders from the Sales & Customer Experience Unit
	Pick, pack, and prepare customer orders accurately
	Ensure all customer orders are dispatched within 24 hours


Personalisation & Digital Support:


	Personalise customer orders strictly based on approved instructions
	Arrange products for party packs, gift sets, and digital/photo/video shoots
	Support the Digital / E-commerce Unit during content creation


Internal Coordination:


	Release products to Cashiers strictly for ERP-recorded sales
	Maintain clear communication with Sales, Digital, and Finance teams


Education & Qualifications


	Minimum educational qualification: ND or NCE with 0-1 year experience
	Additional training in inventory, logistics, or store management is an added advantage


Other Requirements:


	Must reside within Lekki / Jakande axis
	Willingness to work on a rotational shift basis
	Ability to work in a structured, control-driven environment
	High level of honesty, discipline, and accountability
	Strict compliance with company policies and procedures is mandatory.


Required Skills & Competencies:


	Strong attention to detail and record-keeping ability
	Basic knowledge of inventory management and stock control
	Ability to use ERP systems and basic computer applications
	Good organizational and time-management skills
	Ability to follow instructions and company procedures strictly
	Teamwork and effective communication skills
	Physical stamina for handling stock and warehouse activities


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV / Resume to: hcm@customgiftsanddesigns.com and copy (CC) customgiftsanddesigns@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "title": "Finance & Control Officer",
  "description": "Custom Gifts &amp; Designs is a reputable business platform that promotes consumer access to premium gift packaging services and quality retail supplies. Our platform is propagated via partnerships and proven proprietary business systems that assure a holistic shopping experience for every occasion.&nbsp;Together with everyone in our ecosystem, we continue to develop our iconic CGD&trade; brand by inspiring stronger social ties with our novelty gifts offering.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance &amp; Control Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Finance &amp; Control Officer is responsible for managing, monitoring, and controlling all financial activities of the company.
	This role ensures accurate financial reporting, strong internal controls, compliance with company policies, and financial integrity across all departments.


Responsibilities


	Manage and oversee all financial records and transactions of the company
	Ensure accurate recording of sales, expenses, and operational costs
	Review, validate, and reconcile daily sales reports submitted by Cashiers
	Monitor and enforce internal control systems to prevent fraud, errors, or financial leakages
	Prepare financial and management reports for review and decision-making
	Reconcile accounts, invoices, and payment records on a regular basis
	Ensure full compliance with company financial policies and procedures
	Support budgeting, forecasting, and cost control initiatives
	Work closely with the Cashier, HR/Admin, and Management teams
	Maintain strict confidentiality and integrity of all financial information


Educational Qualification


	
	Strictly BSc or HND in Accounting or a related discipline.
	


Experience:


	Must have 2&ndash;5 years of relevant experience in finance, accounting, or control functions
	Experience in internal control, audit, or retail/operations finance is an added advantage


Skills:


	Strong knowledge of accounting principles and financial controls
	High analytical and numerical skills
	Excellent attention to detail and accuracy
	Ability to detect discrepancies and financial risks
	Strong reporting and documentation skills
	Integrity, confidentiality, and professionalism
	Proficiency in spreadsheets, ERP systems, and basic accounting tools


Other Requirements:


	Ability to work in a structured, control-driven environment
	Strong ethical standards and zero tolerance for financial misconduct
	Ability to work with multiple departments and enforce compliance
	Willingness to take responsibility and work under pressure


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV / Resume to:&nbsp;hcm@customgiftsanddesigns.com&nbsp;and copy (CC)&nbsp;customgiftsanddesigns@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Finance & Control Officer Job at Custom Gifts & Designs




        
    

        
        Custom Gifts & Designs is a reputable business platform that promotes consumer access to premium gift packaging services and quality retail supplies. Our platform is propagated via partnerships and proven proprietary business systems that assure a holistic shopping experience for every occasion. Together with everyone in our ecosystem, we continue to develop our iconic CGD™ brand by inspiring stronger social ties with our novelty gifts offering.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance & Control Officer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Finance & Control Officer is responsible for managing, monitoring, and controlling all financial activities of the company.
	This role ensures accurate financial reporting, strong internal controls, compliance with company policies, and financial integrity across all departments.


Responsibilities


	Manage and oversee all financial records and transactions of the company
	Ensure accurate recording of sales, expenses, and operational costs
	Review, validate, and reconcile daily sales reports submitted by Cashiers
	Monitor and enforce internal control systems to prevent fraud, errors, or financial leakages
	Prepare financial and management reports for review and decision-making
	Reconcile accounts, invoices, and payment records on a regular basis
	Ensure full compliance with company financial policies and procedures
	Support budgeting, forecasting, and cost control initiatives
	Work closely with the Cashier, HR/Admin, and Management teams
	Maintain strict confidentiality and integrity of all financial information


Educational Qualification


	
	Strictly BSc or HND in Accounting or a related discipline.
	


Experience:


	Must have 2–5 years of relevant experience in finance, accounting, or control functions
	Experience in internal control, audit, or retail/operations finance is an added advantage


Skills:


	Strong knowledge of accounting principles and financial controls
	High analytical and numerical skills
	Excellent attention to detail and accuracy
	Ability to detect discrepancies and financial risks
	Strong reporting and documentation skills
	Integrity, confidentiality, and professionalism
	Proficiency in spreadsheets, ERP systems, and basic accounting tools


Other Requirements:


	Ability to work in a structured, control-driven environment
	Strong ethical standards and zero tolerance for financial misconduct
	Ability to work with multiple departments and enforce compliance
	Willingness to take responsibility and work under pressure


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV / Resume to: hcm@customgiftsanddesigns.com and copy (CC) customgiftsanddesigns@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "NOC Engineer",
  "description": "Cobranet Limited; a reputable organization incorporated in 2003 and provides internet solutions. Our footprint and range of products have grown immensely since incorporation and we are proud to provide every segment of society with a reliable link to the digital universe.

Our entire network topology is rugged, dynamic and fully redundant with negligible downtimes: content showing extremely high availability exceeding 99.5%. Our promise is to continue providing innovative solutions at the best feature-to-price and service-to-price ratio.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: NOC Engineer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description:


	Perform general &ldquo;system administration&rdquo; tasks on all elements of the network
	Discover problem areas which could negatively impact system performance or customer satisfaction
	Pro?actively monitor network and system performance.
	Analyze traffic data and trends and escalate areas of concern to the network design authority.
	Escalate problems to third level support (Problem management team) where these cannot be resolved within the Network Operations Centre (NOC).
	Perform general &ldquo;system administration&rdquo; tasks on all elements of the network.
	Perform network surveillance 24/7, respond to network?reported and customer?reported problems
	Take ownership to ensure that all problems are resolved in a timely and efficient manner.
	Manage problem resolution using network monitoring/management tools
	Monitor key suppliers service levels and highlight where Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are not being met.


Requirements


	Education and qualifications: BSc / HND in Computer Engineering/Telecommunications
	Strong communications skills both written and verbal.
	Capable of making solid, fact-based decisions under pressure.
	Ability to work well in an international, multi-cultural, and high-pressure technical environment.
	Technical experience in a telecommunications or network operations environment. &bull; Very Good understanding of Fixed Wireless communications Technology
	Cisco CCNA/CCNP certification.
	Knowledgeable to Manage Cisco switches
	Interested candidates must be able to work on a 24/7 shift Rotation


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and&nbsp;qualified&nbsp;candidates should send their CV&nbsp;to:&nbsp;recruitment@cobranet.ng&nbsp;using &quot;NOC Engineer&quot; as the subject of the mail.

NOC Engineer Job at Cobranet Limited




        
    

        
        Cobranet Limited; a reputable organization incorporated in 2003 and provides internet solutions. Our footprint and range of products have grown immensely since incorporation and we are proud to provide every segment of society with a reliable link to the digital universe.

Our entire network topology is rugged, dynamic and fully redundant with negligible downtimes: content showing extremely high availability exceeding 99.5%. Our promise is to continue providing innovative solutions at the best feature-to-price and service-to-price ratio.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: NOC Engineer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Job Description:


	Perform general “system administration” tasks on all elements of the network
	Discover problem areas which could negatively impact system performance or customer satisfaction
	Pro?actively monitor network and system performance.
	Analyze traffic data and trends and escalate areas of concern to the network design authority.
	Escalate problems to third level support (Problem management team) where these cannot be resolved within the Network Operations Centre (NOC).
	Perform general “system administration” tasks on all elements of the network.
	Perform network surveillance 24/7, respond to network?reported and customer?reported problems
	Take ownership to ensure that all problems are resolved in a timely and efficient manner.
	Manage problem resolution using network monitoring/management tools
	Monitor key suppliers service levels and highlight where Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are not being met.


Requirements


	Education and qualifications: BSc / HND in Computer Engineering/Telecommunications
	Strong communications skills both written and verbal.
	Capable of making solid, fact-based decisions under pressure.
	Ability to work well in an international, multi-cultural, and high-pressure technical environment.
	Technical experience in a telecommunications or network operations environment. • Very Good understanding of Fixed Wireless communications Technology
	Cisco CCNA/CCNP certification.
	Knowledgeable to Manage Cisco switches
	Interested candidates must be able to work on a 24/7 shift Rotation


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@cobranet.ng using "NOC Engineer" as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be shortlisted.
